intro: Campylocentrum cuyuniae, commonly known as the Cuyunia hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
